name: The Privilege Floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just to add to the array of wonderful comments. This place is very special and it's staff are ALL excellent. Your every needs are taken care of and nothing is ever to much trouble. I would highly recommend you book this hotel and experience for yourself a true 5 star hotel. Thank you to everyone at the privilege floor for an amazing stay.
reviews.title: Truly amazing
Best Honeymoon ever!
reviews.text: We stayed at the resort for 7 nights and received 1st class treatment from the day we arrived to Cambodia to the day we leave. Alex and his staff has been really great to us, making the trip the most comfortable experience we ever had.

The lounge is a nice place to relax away from the pool or back from a long day of sight seeing. The staff are wonderful. They will definitely put a smile on your face when ordering and receiving the order. They also have free cocktails from five in the evening till seven.
reviews.title: Superb
Service par excellence!
reviews.text: The room we had is nice and spacious. The cleaning staff are really nice and friendly, and the room is cleaned up after a long day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also had a private driver which brought us everywhere within siem reap. The driver we had is really friendly. He recommended us nice sight seeing places to go and have us some information about the place before we start.
reviews.title: Absolutely Superb..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard of customer service at Borei Angkor and the Privilege Floor in particular can only be described as impeccable ! It was a genuine pleasure to rise in the morning and be greeted by members of staff who were obviously pleased to see us and were eager to make our visit as enjoyable and memorable as possible. In the dining area, Samrang and Say did everything possible to expand upon the experience by suggesting and providing local cuisine that was both delicious and different.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: Nor did the standards fall off at any time during the day. Our driver, Mr Bros was pleasant, smiling, courteous and efficient. Nothing was too much trouble - a characteristic shared by all members of the team. Our guide Nikay was very knowledgeable, helpful and most importantly flexible and understanding of our requirements.
reviews.title: Sensational

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sean and Jacky co-ordinated everything with remarkable precision and efficiency. Again, nothing was too much trouble and it is considerable testament to Sean's ability that we never felt uncomfortable or in any way insecure at any time during our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent service and beautiful hotel

reviews.text: The high standards continued through to a very enjoyable cocktail evening when our attendant who we dubbed 'Superman' provided great entertainment as well as the most unbelievably wonderful 'Cambodian' Slings.
reviews.title: The best stay ever!!

reviews.text: If we have left anyone out, it is not because of a lack of service but more that those mentioned featured most prominently in our stay. In conclusion, what has been created here is exceptional and well beyond any expectations.
reviews.title: Truly privilege and pampered

reviews.text: We only stayed one night here but wish we stayed longer. The staff are so kind and helpful, they're 100% dedicated to making your stay as comfortable and lovely as possible. There was so much included in the price such as laundry, private driver, breakfast and champagne etc. We absolutely LOVED it here!
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stay on the Privileged Floor of the Borei Angkor Resort and Spa. The service from the staff was outstanding from the time we arrived until the moment we departed. Our stay on the Privileged Floor was the highlight of our holiday in Asia. We only had a few days to spend in Cambodia as part of one-leg of a three-leg vacation. Due to the limited time, I wanted to make sure we were able to see as many temples and as much of Siem Reap as possible. The exceptional service on the Privileged Floor made this possible and also ensured that we were not overtired or overwhelmed with a hectic tourist schedule to actually enjoy our vacation. We especially want to publicly state how amazing Jackie, Alex, Say, and especially our driver, Noeurn, were during our vacation. They were extremely responsive and friendly, and their constant positive attitudes made any concerns go away. I highly recommend the Borei Angkor hotel and especially the Privileged Floor to anyone visiting Siem Reap.
reviews.title: "So good that I felt compelled to write a review"

reviews.text: My husband and I came to th privilege floor on our honeymoon. We could not have wished for anything better than what we found at the privilege floor.
reviews.title: Amazing experience in an amazing hotel!

reviews.text: We opted for the sunset package which provided us with unlimited benefits and was well worth the price.
reviews.title: This is how all hotels should be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful tour guide accompany us on a tour each day who was extremely knowledgeable, knew all the best photo spots and was always willing to think of ideas on what else she could take us to see.
reviews.title: Wow! 5 star service all the way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and so glad for our choice. We were picked up from Airport in nice car with AC and brought to the hotel. Check in was very smooth and personal. Room is so nice and big with big balcony overlooking pool. Room is very clean and has flat screen TV, safe, robes, slippers and mini bar with cold drinks. Free laundry service is included and its kinda needed here in hot and humid weather. Lounge has Cocktail hour from 5-7 with appetizers and drinks. We do not drink alcohol, but we were offered fresh juices and soda.
reviews.title: Awesome Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is very personal and they know you by name. We had a car included with our stay which is very nice because its so hot for tuk-tuk. Driver is available 24 hours. We used car for our tours and staff was very helpful to organize our time here.
reviews.title: Great Place for Exceptional Service

reviews.text: Breakfast spread was very nice and catered to Westerners as well to the local cuisine.
reviews.title: Amazing staff - absolutely an all inclusive hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reading TripAdvisor review has been so helpful through the years, and this time was no exception. As reported, this is not a hotel per se, but the top floor of another hotel, the Borei. Service for this floor is over the top, so much so that it may be a bit much for travelers seeking a quieter experience. The two representatives who took such good care of us, Alex and Kim, were professional, enthusiastic, and extremely helpful. They assured us that every detail would be right. Our driver, Sinai, was equally professional and charming. Say in the lounge was delightful, and the two young ladies who provided the massage were amazing. That said, it's a bit of a drive to the temples (which is why you really need 24 hour car and driver service) and the grounds and construction elements do not compare to several other resorts in the area
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at this hotel are amazing. I think more hotels should be like this - The staff really care about making your stay as enjoyable as it can be. They greet you by name, arrange for all your needs, and not to mention the extras. When I said all inclusive, I meant all inclusive. Free use of a cellphone for all your local calls, your own personal transport - you get your own driver and a car (not a tuktuk) to travel around Siem reap (this also includes the temples, btw, so you only need to pay for the guide), free laundry service (if you go quadbiking, which I really recommend, this is absolutely neccessary), free happy hour (and I'm talking cocktails + munchies)... and the breakfast was awesome. I don't recommend eating up on the 4th floor (not that it was bad), just that the 1st floor has a massive breakfast spread. and most of it was delicious, especially the pho. The service at this hotel is 5 star in every sense, and the attentive staff really made our trip memorable. Thank you so much to Alex, Morgan, and everyone else at The Privilege Floor!
reviews.title: The only way to stay

description: The Privilege Floor offers unparalleled privacy and comfort that truly redefines the meaning of privilege. ‘Wake up slow’ and immerse yourself in the finest our hospitality has to offer. The Privilege Floor is separately best located on the fourth floor of a 5-star property of Borei Angkor Resort & Spa and houses to 19 elegantly decorated rooms and suites with Cambodia’s original silk products, assorted handicraft and wooden floor with private balcony overlooking the refreshing view of sunset, tropical garden and swimming pool.
